That phenomenon where the driver is not usually hurt or doesn't die is because they are so inebriated that there body is at a non-stress like state. It's like a cat falling from a tree, physiologically, it's not experiencing any stress so it manages to twist and turns its body so that it lands on the ground feet first. I know it doesn't seem fair at all. There is nothing fair when a drunk driver survives and their victim dies.

Yes they should get leave to spend time with their family. It's 10 freakin days. Not 2 weeks or 6 weeks or even months. My husband works 12-14 hr days ever since I met him, he's been in deployments, field ops, training ops and other stuff for the marine corps. When he's not doing that he gets to spend 2 hrs with our boys before bedtime. He's missed bdays, anniversaries, holidays. He's gone a lot and we hardly see him so yes I think the marine corps can sacrifice 10 days and put family first for those 10 days
